5.6. Static Balance
In (3 + 1) dimensions, exact solutions to the two-body problem in general relativity
have been unobtainable, primarily because gravitational radiation carries energy away
from the system. However, a condition of static balance—in which gravitational attraction
is exactly balanced by electromagnetic repulsion—was attained for two bodies [112,113]
and later for N bodies on a line [114]. This condition is
